Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with part of rosette and part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (tip of wing remaining) to left; pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd within the Chalice Style, yet in her description of the sherd she omits the pendant roundel. Such filling ornament does not feature in the Chalice Style, yet is common in the earlier Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no. 885)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0457) (phase 2)
